name: Do not use COMMON blocks in Fortran-90 in Programs  (FORTRAN)
description: Any artifact that contains 1 or more of these COMMON blocks are considered being in violation.
rationale: Do not use COMMON. Use module. Modules are collections of data, type definitions and procedure definitions, which give a more secure and general replacement for the COMMON concept.
remediation: Replace the COMMON construct(s) with a module and include this into the artifact.
alternativeName: Do not use COMMON blocks in Fortran-90 in Programs  (FORTRAN)
